main_definition: Gotten is the past participle of 'get', used to describe acquiring or obtaining something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To receive or acquire, often as a result of effort or action
meanings_and_examples.example: She finally gotten her driver's license after weeks of practice.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to indicate that something has happened, typically in the past, especially when it is surprising or noteworthy
meanings_and_examples.example: I can't believe I gotten lost on my way home last night!

meanings_and_examples.definition: To become affected by a disease or illness
meanings_and_examples.example: He gotten the flu after attending the crowded concert.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to describe becoming something, often in an informal sense (particularly common with 'gone' as 'gotten old')
meanings_and_examples.example: She's really gotten into painting since she retired last year.
